issue.title: [Feature] DbContextExtensions in EF8 do not require existing DbSets

repository.name: EFCorePowerTools
repository.description: Entity Framework Core Power Tools - reverse engineering, migrations and model visualization in Visual Studio & CLI

issue.body:
Hello,

Just a suggestion, to adapt the DbContextExtensions SqlQueryAsync method to not require DbSets anymore as EF Core 8 says that it is working without.
I have changed it in my stripped version and it works fine, i REMOVED 100 DbSets created for nothing there cluterring my context.

My changes to the code ( commented is the previous way )

```csharp
if ( typeof( T ).GetProperties( ).Any( ) ) {
	//return await db.Set<T>().FromSqlRaw(sql, parameters).ToListAsync(cancellationToken);
	return await db.Database
		.SqlQueryRaw<T>( sql , parameters )
		.ToListAsync( cancellationToken );
}

```

Made it after checking EF8 Documentation: [(https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/ef/core/what-is-new/ef-core-8.0/whatsnew#raw-sql-queries-for-unmapped-types)]

Otherwise, thank you again for your effort making such a nice tool, hope you had a nice and peaceful Christmas with your family, wish a better New Year 2024.

### Provide steps to reproduce a bug

Please include a **complete** description of the issue or link to a project that I can run to reproduce the issue.

### Provide technical details

- EF Core Power Tools version: (found in About dialog - blue questionmark icon on context menu)

- Exact Visual Studio version: (e.g. Visual Studio 2022 17.6.5)

- Database engine: (SQL Server, Azure SQL, Postgres, Oracle, Firebird, SQLite, MySQL)

- EF Core version in use: (e.g. EF Core 7)

- Is Handlebars templates used: no/yes

- Is T4 templates used: no/yes

- Is a SQL Server .dacpac used: no/yes

body: @ErikEJ Thanks for the ping--I missed this before. Looks like a bug.

issue.title: Don't discover DbFunctions when building ad-hoc model

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Fixes #32680

Two follow on items after this is merged:
- Port to 8
- Make AdHocMapper public

issue.title: [release/8.0] Don't discover DbFunctions when building ad-hoc model

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Fixes #32680
Port of #32790

### Description

Raw SQL queries for unmapped types will fail if a DbFunction is registered on the DbContext and the referenced entity type does not map by convention.

### Customer impact

Raw SQL queries will throw in this scenario.

### How found

Customer reported on 8.

### Regression

No. Raw SQL queries for unmapped types is a new feature in 8.0.

### Testing

Tests added.

### Risk

Low. Quirked.
